intro: Ibatia albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered ibatia, is a tropical plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking white flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its stems are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
